comments.text: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.8.1.5) Gecko/20070713 Firefox/2.0.0.5 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.8.1.5) Gecko/20070713 Firefox/2.0.0.5 I need to have an HTML img tag inside a button tag (please see reasons below). But mouse events on the img tag do not work as they should in this situation. If this cannot be fixed, then documentation of the precise action of a button tag might help. Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.[HTML within a form] Actual Results: In Firefox: The onClick and onMouseOver do not execute the JavaScript. Clicking changes the button alignment. alt and title do nothing. In IE6: onMouseOver (only) executes the JavaScript. Clicking changes the button alignment. alt does nothing. title appears only after clicking. Now remove the button start and end tags and repeat. In Firefox: onMouseOver and onClick execute the JavaScript. title appears. In IE6: onMouseOver and onClick execute the JavaScript. onMouseOver fires again after clicking. alt and title do nothing. Expected Results: It is as though the button behaviour masks the desired img behaviour. I would like the img events to behave in the same way with or without the button tag. Any 3D button behaviour should not interfere with them. This is to enable a form element to have an image and a tabindex, without acting as a submit button (so input button and input image are no good). This might be more of a feature than a bug, but if so it would be helpful to have some documentation of the button action or a suggestion of a workaround.

This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile.
